reviews.review_msg: This was a difficult class, but very interesting and worth the hard work. Chenier has high standards but is not unfair. I found her very helpful and friendly. Great sense of dry humor. The amount of work was more than other upper level seminar classes, but the course outline did say it was a class meant to prepare one for grad school.

STOP!!! i know u're thinkin of taking her classes during summer semester but seriously, do u really want to listen to her go on and go about gender and sexuality?! this woman bases everything on sexuality. the worst prof ever, not approachable hard marker horride personality

Willeen is very passionate about her classes. She does go off on a tangent here and there and tends to talk a lot so it gets a little boring. But she is very supportive and accessible outside of class. She gives very detailed feedback about essays and has a solid grading criteria she gives in the beginning so you know her expectations.

Willeen is an awesome professor who really cares about her undergraduate students. She's always available and tries to get discussion going without talking too much. The readings were fun and there wasn't too much of it.
